CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bessie Mayweather, housewife, East Liberty, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 24, 1962, pg. 8 with question: "Do you think Pittsburgh Negroes are justified in being angry at the failure of city officials to appoint a Negro as police inspector, in spite of repeated appeals to grant them representation at this level of law enforcement?" Answer reads: "Sure they should be angry, but I don't know how they can do anything about it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bessie Mayweather wearing patterned scarf, standing in front of Fannie Farmer store window with striped awning, Downtown
